title: Harish Rawat administers oath of cleanliness to students
text:
Tribune News Service
Dehradun, October 2
Mahatma Gandhi not just dreamt of India free from the British rule but also of a country free from poverty and filth. Chief Minister Harish Rawat stated this here today while administering the oath of cleanliness to schoolchildren at a programme held here to mark the birth anniversary of the Father of the Nation. The Chief Minister said Gandhiji was a great man and an inclusive India of today was his contribution to the nation. The Chief Minister said Gandhiji had boundless affection for the poor, backward and the depressed classes. He said Gandhiji’s theory of non-violence has become all more relevant in today’s terror-affected world, he added. “Gandhiji’s non-violence theory not only helped to free India from imperialism, but more than 100 countries got freedom by adopting his non-violence mode of agitation,”he said. The Chief Minister said enough cleanliness work had been done under Nirmal Bharat, which was now being further accelerated under Swachh Bharat. The government was determined to making Bageshwar and Chamoli as Nirmal districts. Meanwhile, the Chief Minister also paid tributes to former Prime Minister Lal Bahadur Shastri on his birth anniversary. He described him as a simple person with great thinking. Paul pays tributes
Governor KK Paul paid tributes to Mahatma Gandhi and former Prime Minister Lal Bahadur Shastri at a function held at Raj Bhavan. He spoke about the struggle and sacrifices of both leaders during the freedom movement. He said the country would always remain indebted to Gandhiji for what he did for the nation. Everybody should follow Gandhiji’s ideology. Paul said it was everyone’s duty to contribute towards nation’s development and create an environment of peace, safety and harmony in the country. Shastriji was an epitome of simplicity and his ideals are extremely relevant even in today’s world. Chief Minister Harish Rawat garlanded photographs of Gandhiji and Shastriji. He appealed to the residents to work for the development of the state. MLA Sunder Lal Mandrawal, Chief Secretary Rakesh Sharma, Principal Secretary Om Prakash, Ranbir Singh, Radha Raturi, DGP BS Sidhu and other officials were present on the occasion. Assembly Speaker Govind Singh Kunjwal paid tributes to both leaders at another function held at the Vidhan Sabha. Uttarakhand Jal Vidyut Nigam Limited held celebrations on its premises. DGP BS Sidhu paid tributes to Gandhiji and Shastriji at a function held at the police headquarters campus. He said everyone should contribute towards communal harmony in the state. Plantation drive
Kaash, a voluntary organisation, celebrated the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri by organising a plantation drive on the campus of Government Polytechnic College, Pithuwala. Principal, staff, school students and volunteers of Kaash participated in the event. Kids hold march
Students of Green Field School, under its Gandhi Resource Center (GRC), organised the 2nd awareness rally to support the Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao campaign on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti. The students of class VI, VII and VIII gathered on the school campus on Mohini Road and paid tributes to Mahatma Gandhi and former Prime Minister Lal Bahadur Shastri. School principal Reena Jaggi flagged off the rally after brief competitions such as a quiz on Gandhi, drawing, and slogan writing.
